same configuration as comment 2 works for 1.5.0_06
Shmuel, your error looks quite different - can you enter a new bug against Platform UI for your case?
Shmuel, John. IMHO there is no need to open a new bug report as bug 134689 already deals with the problem mentioned in comment 2.
Analysis accepted. It does seem like bug 134689 is releated to the problem that I saw. I'll try the fix and enter a new bug report if it doesn't help.

Heinz, which problem do you refer to? The first exception with which you opened the bug (!ENTRY org.eclipse.update.configurator 2006-04-15 10:46:48.471
!MESSAGE Could not load from shared install !STACK 0 java.lang.Exception) or the one opened by shmuel (java.lang.InternalError: Can't map string pool offset 20273 to index).

If it is the first one, I need to get more details on your setup. It seems that you are running from a shared install.

(In reply to comment #8)
Pascal, sorry for my litte bit inaccurate comment #7 - I referred to my original problem (!ENTRY org.eclipse.update.configurator 2006-04-15 10:46:48.471).

Unfortunately I am not sure what's the meaning of a "a shared install", so I try to describe my installation in my own words.

I have unpacked the distribution-tar-ball (eclipse-SDK-3.2RC1-linux-gtk.tar.gz) under the directory /usr/local/java (with user root) and start it with my normal (non root) account.

And that's part of the problem as I just discovered while writing this. It looks like that it is necessary to start eclipse for the 1st time as root (which is the only account which has write permissions to the install-directory). After that normal accounts (without write permissions) can start eclipse too. 

As far as I remember it is the first time it's necessary to start a new eclipse installation initially with root - I would prefer to avoid that in the future - if possible ;-) 
Otherwise it would be fine to add a hint in the installation guide - if it hasn't be done yet and I overlooked it.

Bye
Heinz

Pascal, do we have a doc/FAQ/readme entry that describes the requirements for installing Eclipse on Linux? Does it describe the case Heinz is seeing?

I don't believe there is an outstanding problem here. Suggest closing as WORKSFORME.

There is no documentation specific to linux install, but we have doc on how to setup an eclipse install for multi users, which is equivalent. See 
Platform Plug-in Developer Guide > Reference > Other ref info > Multi-user installs.
